result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven C Higgins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Attempt Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**21 days credit if probation revoked.**  *Cases 21CM946, 21CF1338, 21CF1364 dismissed and read in.*

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: With 21CF1272 Counts 1 and 2 and 21CM891 Count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven C Higgins

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.

(2:28 PM cases 21CM891, 21CM946, 21CF1272, 21CF1280, 21CF1316, 21CF1338, 21CF1364, 22CF393, 22CF394, 22CF581, 22CF719, 21FO1983, 22FO281 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven C Higgins in court, in custody. Attorney James H Krave in court for Steven C Higgins.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF719 and Court accepts waiver.
State will file an Information which will mirror the criminal complaint. Attorney Krave has no objection to moving forward without the Information on file and understand the Information will mirror the complaint.

Defendant pleads Guilty to 21CM891 Amended Count 1: County Disorderly Conduct as an ordinance violation, Count 2: Criminal Damage to Property, 21CF1272 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine, 21CF1280 Amended Count 1: County Disorderly Conduct as an ordinance violation, 21CF1316 Amended Count 1: County Disorderly Conduct as an ordinance violation, 22CF393 Count 4: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, 22CF394 Count 4: Carrying a Concealed Knife, 22CF581 Count 4: Criminal Damage to Property and No Contest to 21CF1272 Count 2: Operating a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, 22CF719 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping, Count 5: Misdemeanor Bail Jumping and Count 11: Attempt Misdemeanor Battery.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty and No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CM891 Amended Count 1, Count 2, 21CF1272 Count 1, 21CF1280 Amended Count 1, 21CF1316 Amended Count 1, 22CF393 Count 4, 22CF394 Count 4, 22CF581 Count 4, 21CF1272 Count 2, 22CF719 Count 1, Count 5 and Count 11.

Parties request the Court follow the joint sentencing recommendation and make statements in support.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on 3 years probation on 21CF1272 Count 1 and 22CF719 Count 1 and 2 years probation on 21CM891 Count 2 and 21CF1272 Count 2 with the following conditions:
180 days jail without Huber privileges on 21CF1272 Count 2, stayed pending further order of the Court. AODA and follow through with recommendations which must be completed within 6 months. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. No contact with victims K.J., S.S. No contact with Amber Inn, P.P., H.S., A.J. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs x4. Court orders credit of 42 days on 21CM891, 40 days on 21CF1272 and 21 days on 22CF719 if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including cases 21CM946, 21CF1338, 21CF1364, 21FO1983, 22FO281 are dismissed and read in.

Court orders sentence on 22CF393 Count 1, 22CF394 Count 4, 22CF719 Count 5 and Count 11 for the defendant to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court orders sentence on 21CM891 Amended Count 1, 21CF1280 Amended Count 1 and 21CF1316 Amended Count 1 to pay court costs. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Court orders the $50.00 and $250.00 bonds posted in 22CF394 are to be applied to court costs. Court orders if the defendant is revoked on probation any outstanding financial obligation is reduced to civil judgment. Defendant requests the airsoft gun be returned. State has no objection. Court orders the airsoft gun is to be returned to the defendant.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:39 AM cases 21CF1272, 21CF1280, 21CF1316, 21CF1338, 21CF1364, 21CM891, 21CM946, 22CF393, 22CF394, 22CF581, 22CF719 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven C Higgins in court, in custody.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Steven C Higgins. 
In 22CF581: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
Defendant enters not guilty pleas in all misdemeanor files. Defendant to be fingerprinted in 22CF581. 
A status conference (possible plea) is scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 2:30 PM (30 min, in person).
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:00 AM Cases called: 21CF1272, 21CF1280, 21CF1316, 21CF1338, 21CF1364, 21CM891, 21CM946, 22CF393, 22CF394, 22CF581 & 22CF719. Defendant Steven C Higgins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Steven C Higgins.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

ARGN on 21CM891, 21CM946, 22CF581: 07/12/22 at 8:30am in person. The rest of the files will have a STC at the same date and time.

Cases called at 11:10 AM: 22CF393, 21CM946, 22CF719, 21CM891, 22CF581, 21CF1316, 21CF1280, 21CF1338, 21CF1364, 21CF1272, 22CF394. 
Defendant Steven C Higgins appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Rachel Robole.   Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants quashed. State requests $5,000 Cash Bond ($4700.00 additional to the $300.00 already posted) as the Defendant has 11 open cases. 
Court orders a $1,500 Cash Bond (Defendant must post an additional $1,200.00 to be released from custody) with all previous conditions from all bonds to apply in addition to conditions requested relating to 22CF719. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived in case 22CF719.
ARGN/STC: 7/11/22 at 10:00 AM (Branch 3).

Conditions:
No contact with K.J., T.W.
No contact with S.S., Amber Inn.
No contact with H.S., A.J., D.H. or their residences or Holiday Inn Express.
No contact with Kwik Trip (located at 108 W. Madison St.), Barstow Court Businesses. 
No contact with Sojourner House or victim P.P.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
(Covers 22CF719, 22CF393, 21CM946, 21CM891, 22CF581, 21CF1316, 21CF1280, 21cf1338, 21CF1364, 21CF1272, 22CF394)

(4:02 PM cases 21CM891, 21CM946, 21CF1272, 21CF1280, 21CF1316, 21CF1338, 21CF1364, 22CF393, 22CF394, 22CF581, 22CF719 called.)
Court orders warrants on all cases, except case 22CF719. 
Case 21CF1338 should be referred to Branch 1 to address warrant, case 21CF1364 should be referred to Branch 2 to address warrant and cases 21CM891, 21CM946, 22CF393, 22CF394, 22CF581 should be referred to Branch 5 to address warrant.
Case 22CF719 is scheduled for an Initial Appearance on July 12, 2022 at 11 am.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
